Text:
You want an `else` clause in the case expression.

    Select 
        b.branch_id, 
        b.name, 
        Case when b.state = 'MA' then 'Out of State' else b.address end as address, 
        b.city, 
        b.state, 
        b.zip
    from branch b

You want an `else` clause in the case expression.

    Select 
        b.branch_id, 
        b.name, 
        Case when b.state = 'MA' then 'Out of State' else b.address end as address, 
        b.city, 
        b.state, 
        b.zip
    from branch b

This will set the address column to 'Out of State' for all rows where state = 'MA'. Maybe you want it the other way around, if so just negate the condition.
